description: This course introduces students to the history and art of ancient Greece.  It covers more than two
thousand years of Greek civilization, from the bronze age through the archaic, classical, and
Hellenistic periods.  The itinerary takes students to every major region of Greece, with extended
stays in Athens, Crete, and the Peloponnese. When not visiting museums and archaeological sites
and learning about ancient Greek culture, students have the opportunity to experience modern
Greek culture as well.  Offered annually. Counts towards ancient studies major.
